page.title: 07ASHFORD MANOR GOLF CLUB
page.content: The first golf in this area was played on Staines Moor.Eight local men bought the farm in Ashford and turned it into a Golf Club in 1898. The club will always be a golf club because they went to the court to make sure. There are 18 holes and in a round you walk about 5 miles or more depending on how good a golfer you are! The ground is on gravel so they have to bring in extra soil.The clubhouse is pretty large and very comfortable. They have 8 people to look after the fairways and greens,one of these green_keepers is a lady. The Staines By Pass runs along one side of the golf course.
